intro: Myosotis alpestris subsp. asiatica, commonly known as the Asian forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the tips of the stems. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its charming appearance.
